abstract: Jackson Hole Journal; more than thousand families on outskirts of Beijing have moved into timber-frame houses with big backyards on streets with American names in huge resort community; luxury real estate venture, known in Chinese as Hometown America, resembles American frontier towns; more than 90 percent of 1,500 homes in community are sold, with prices ranging from $625,000-$8,000,000.
lead_paragraph: On the outskirts of Beijing, more than 1,000 families have settled into a community modeled after an American frontier town, on streets with names like Aspen, Moose and Route 66.

headline.main: Living a Frontier Dream on the Outskirts of China’s Capital
headline.print_headline: Living a Frontier Dream on Beijing’s Outskirts

snippet: On the outskirts of Beijing, more than 1,000 families have settled into a community modeled after an American frontier town, on streets with names like Aspen, Moose and Route 66.
